citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
During the inspection there were approximately 26 out of 30 expired medications – all of which were being used, or
intended to be used, on the animals. This was confirmed by a facility representative. The expiration and ‘discard by’ dates
ranged from 2020 to March 2023. Usage of expired drugs can cause injury and/or suffering to the animals and are
ineffective for their intended use. Each dealer shall establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that
include the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries.
Correct by: April 20, 2023

There were three miniature schnauzer puppies housed in a primary enclosure where the height of the enclosure was
insufficient. The ears of two of the three animals would fold over up against the surface of the top of the enclosure
whenever they would stand up in a normal posture. Adequate space to make normal postural movements is an essential
aspect of ensuring the health and wellbeing of the animals contained therein as it avoids creating stress/anxiety and
discomfort, among other things. The interior height of a primary enclosure must be at least 6 inches higher than the head
of the tallest dog in the enclosure when it is in a normal standing position.
Correct by: April 24, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative and the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
During the inspection there were approximately 26 out of 30 expired medications – all of which were being used, or 
intended to be used, on the animals. This was confirmed by a facility representative. The expiration and ‘discard by’ dates 
ranged from 2020 to March 2023. Usage of expired drugs can cause injury and/or suffering to the animals and are 
ineffective for their intended use. Each dealer shall establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that 
include the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries.  
 
Correct by: April 20, 2023 
3.6(c)(1)(iii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
There were three miniature schnauzer puppies housed in a primary enclosure where the height of the enclosure was 
insufficient. The ears of two of the three animals would fold over up against the surface of the top of the enclosure 
whenever they would stand up in a normal posture. Adequate space to make normal postural movements is an essential 
aspect of ensuring the health and wellbeing of the animals contained therein as it avoids creating stress/anxiety and 
discomfort, among other things. The interior height of a primary enclosure must be at least 6 inches higher than the head

of the tallest dog in the enclosure when it is in a normal standing position.  
 
Correct by: April 24, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative and the licensee. 
 
 n

species.common: DJUNGARIAN / RUSSIAN WINTER WHITE DWARF HAMSTER
